intro: Aster alpinus var. serpentimontanus, commonly known as the Alpine aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly serrated edge. This variety is well adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, making it a hardy plant suitable for alpine gardens.
